Fix Railway deployment: Add frontend Dockerfile and resolve TypeScript build errors

- Add frontend-specific Dockerfile for Railway deployment with multi-stage build
  - Uses Node.js 20 Alpine with pnpm via corepack
  - Optimized production image with vite preview server
  
- Add comprehensive Railway setup guide (RAILWAY_SETUP_QUICK_START.md)
  - Step-by-step instructions for configuring Root Directory
  - Troubleshooting common deployment issues
  - Alternative deployment approaches
  
- Fix TypeScript build errors:
  - AgentExecutionDetails.tsx: Add null check for Object.entries to prevent
    "Type 'null' is not assignable to parameter" error
  - tsconfig.json: Add vite/client types for proper module resolution

Railway deployment now works correctly when Root Directory is set to ''frontend''.
